That is Riot's definition of a tank. In their new model, a champion with good CC who is tanking is a tank. One with high damage and lower CC is a juggernaut. The problem is, they still have too many exceptions for this to be true. But have stated it's where they wish to push the champions.
you cant be a tank without being tanky. the only thing that could consider lee being a tank is safeguard which is nothing.

You can also be tanky without being a tank, btw.

CC and tankiness makes for a tank, damage and tankiness makes for a bruiser/juggernaut. Defensive steroids **help,** but they are not always a requirement to be a tank (

Lee Sin is a bruiser, because of his E's slow and his main knockup being tied to his ultimate, giving him decent but not tank levels of cc. His safeguard has little to do with that classification.

But, before you misquote me, tankiness **and** good cc makes a tank a tank. CC without the tankiness is typically a support or utility mage (Nami and Orianna are good examples), and tankiness without enough cc is merely a bruiser/juggernaut (Garen is borderline, but Vi and Darius are better examples).
exactly, which classifies lee as a bruiser and not a tank, to my first point being exactly that.

I disagree with both of you here. Lee isn't a bruiser, he isn't a tank, he isn't an assassin (as Riot labels him). He is whatever you want him to be. He can, and does, fill just about every role a melee can.

?

He can fill the tank role in a team comp as much as any other bruiser can, but that doesn't classify him as a tank.

He's some weird fighter/assassin mix. He's most definitely a bruiser, whose kits can fit somewhere between fighter and assassin with Vi being the premiere example, but he doesn't have tank levels of cc. 

He's incredibly versatile, and can be built full tank to full AD and anywhere in between, but that doesn't make him a tank. Tankiness does not define tanks, and Lee just plain doesn't have enough tools due to his generalized (is that the right word? Versatile? Spread out?) kit. If he had some defensive passive steroid, or he had the capability of stunning with a basic ability, he would be a tank (and OP with his current kit). But he isn't. He is *the* premiere, non-juggernaut, bruiser.

**_"And the thing is, you can build him tanky and still be an effective tank"_**

You need a peeler?  Lee's your man.

Just a few base stats at level 18.

Champ A: armour 87, MR 53, HP 2016, shield maxed 200 HP + ap
Champ B: armour 90, MR 53, HP 2038, 85 +17% max HP
Champ C: armour 93, MR 53, HP 2016, 220 HP + ap
Champ D: armour 86, MR 53, HP 2096, none

So not counting utility (mobility, stuns, ect..) or damage, only 1 of those looks really tanky. Although 3 of them are "tanks" by Riot's labels. Being "tanky" is very dependent on items over kit. I'm not saying Lee Sin IS a tank. I'm saying he can be a tank. (He is one of those 4 champs)
